conclusion: Total internal reflection occurs when light from a denser medium to a rarer medium strikes at an angle greater than the critical angle.
The critical angle is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/n, where n is the refractive index.
For no total internal reflection, the angle of incidence must be less than or equal to the critical angle.
The inequality sin(alpha) <= 1/n must be satisfied.
In the triangle formed by the light path, sin(alpha) = d/R.
For no total internal reflection, d/R <= 1/n.
The point light source must be within a distance R/n from the center to avoid total internal reflection.
The position of the point light source must satisfy d <= R/n relative to the center.
